Hardened Definition: The internal cognitive processes an individual agent employs to analyze information, generate solutions, and refine outputs—independent of whether other agents or humans are involved. Captures within-agent cognition only.
Value Creation Logic: Higher reasoning sophistication enables better decision quality, more innovative solutions, and successful handling of complex tasks
Source Basis: Sun et al. (2025); Liu et al. (2025); Li et al. (2025); Hatalis et al. (2023)

Hardened Definition: The extent to which an agent can discover, select, invoke, and orchestrate external tools and services to accomplish tasks
Value Creation Logic: Deeper tool integration expands agent action space, enables automation of technical tasks, and connects to enterprise systems for productivity and revenue value
Source Basis: Mohammadi et al. (2025); Liu et al. (2025); Zhang et al. (2026)

Hardened Definition: The temporal scope and sophistication of information retention mechanisms that enable agents to maintain context and learn from experience
Value Creation Logic: Greater memory persistence enables consistency over long interactions, personalization, and cumulative learning—critical for productivity and decision quality in extended engagements
Source Basis: Hatalis et al. (2023); Mohammadi et al. (2025)

Hardened Definition: The structural arrangement by which multiple agents (or agent-human combinations) organize to divide labor, share information, and integrate outputs—independent of any individual agent's reasoning capability. Captures between-agent architecture only.
Value Creation Logic: Multi-agent coordination enables division of labor, collective intelligence, and handling of tasks beyond single-agent capability—driving productivity and innovation at scale
Source Basis: Liu et al. (2025); Maldonado et al. (2024); Sun et al. (2025)

Hardened Definition: The locus of decision authority determining what goals the agent pursues and what actions it takes—specifically, the degree to which humans vs. the agent controls goal-setting and action-selection. Captures human-agent authority distribution only.
Value Creation Logic: Higher autonomy enables continuous operation and reduced human overhead, while managed autonomy balances productivity gains with appropriate risk mitigation
Source Basis: Morris et al. (2024); Acharya et al. (2025); Liu et al. (2025)

Hardened Definition: The means by which an agent improves its performance or adjusts to new situations over time
Value Creation Logic: Effective adaptation reduces ongoing costs (no retraining), enables continuous improvement, and supports innovation through knowledge transfer
Source Basis: Li et al. (2025); Sun et al. (2025); Wu et al. (2024)

Hardened Definition: The nature and depth of interaction patterns between the agent and human users or team members
Value Creation Logic: Appropriate collaboration modes build trust, ensure value alignment, and enable effective human-AI teaming—critical mediators of actual value realization
Source Basis: Wachowiak et al. (2024); Iftikhar et al. (2024); He et al. (2025)

Hardened Definition: The degree to which an agent operates within organizational policies, regulatory requirements, ethical standards, and intended value alignment
Value Creation Logic: Robust compliance enables enterprise deployment by ensuring regulatory adherence, policy conformance, and sustained alignment with organizational values
Source Basis: OpenAI Preparedness Framework; Mohammadi et al. (2025); Liu et al. (2025); Acharya et al. (2025)

Hardened Definition: The comprehensiveness of mechanisms protecting against harmful outputs, adversarial attacks, system failures, and unintended consequences
Value Creation Logic: Comprehensive safety architecture is prerequisite for scaled deployment, protecting against liability, operational disruption, and reputational harm
Source Basis: OpenAI Preparedness Framework; Mohammadi et al. (2025); Piccialli et al. (2025)
